intro: Henriettea oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed henriettea, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Henriettea oblongifolia is often found in rocky soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool climates. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
